citations.narrative:
Some areas of enclosures were in need of repair/maintenance:
-The red foxes have dug out the back area of their enclosure and exposed some wire where they are digging. Exposed
wire in digging areas could cause injury to the foxes. While digging is a species-typical behavior for foxes and can be
good enrichment, ensure that areas they dig in are routinely maintained (such as regular filling in) to protect them from
contacting wire in areas where digging (Facility reports the foxes have a new enclosure that they will be moved to this
week).
-Some panel points are in an area where a male tiger could contact them next to a shelter. Panel points could injure the
tiger. Ensure that the enclosure is free from any points that the tiger could contact.
-Some scrap metal in the aoudad pen has sharp/rough edges. The aoudads could possibly injure themselves on scrap
metal with rough edges. Ensure that scrap metal is removed and there are no sharp/rough edges in their enclosure.

A live mouse was seen by the food prep table and mineral storage area and mouse droppings were seen in some areas
along the wall of the food storage building. Most animal feed was in rodent-proof containers, however, the presence of
rodents in the food prep and storage area increases the risk of feed contamination. Contaminated feed could make
animals sick. Ensure that a safe and effective program of pest control is in place to control pests including insects,
ectoparasites, avian and mammalian pests (including rats and mice).
***Correct by 5/19/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
Some areas of enclosures were in need of repair/maintenance:  
-The red foxes have dug out the back area of their enclosure and exposed some wire where they are digging.  Exposed 
wire in digging areas could cause injury to the foxes.  While digging is a species-typical behavior for foxes and can be 
good enrichment, ensure that areas they dig in are routinely maintained (such as regular filling in) to protect them from 
contacting wire in areas where digging (Facility reports the foxes have a new enclosure that they will be moved to this 
week).    
-Some panel points are in an area where a male tiger could contact them next to a shelter.  Panel points could injure the 
tiger.  Ensure that the enclosure is free from any points that the tiger could contact.  
-Some scrap metal in the aoudad pen has sharp/rough edges.  The aoudads could possibly injure themselves on scrap 
metal with rough edges.  Ensure that scrap metal is removed and there are no sharp/rough edges in their enclosure. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
A live mouse was seen by the food prep table and mineral storage area and mouse droppings were seen in some areas 
along the wall of the food storage building.  Most animal feed was in rodent-proof containers, however, the presence of

rodents in the food prep and storage area increases the risk of feed contamination.  Contaminated feed could make 
animals sick.  Ensure that a safe and effective program of pest control is in place to control pests including insects, 
ectoparasites, avian and mammalian pests (including rats and mice). 
***Correct by 5/19/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
